channel.description: Recent content in consulting on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Talks and Takeaways from the Scene: Part 2
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I recently went to two Web3 events in Vietnam: Berachain and Babylon. Both were full of energy, with people excited to talk about the future of cryptocurrency.

item.title: Talks and Takeaways from the Scene: Part 1
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hey everyone. I went to 2 cool events in Vietnam recently and I’ve got some fun thoughts to share. Tired of boring tech talk?

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #9: Bybit Loses $1.5B in Hack, Claude 3.7 Sonnet Drops, and OpenArt Designs Characters
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hey everyone, I’ve got some interesting updates from the tech world to share today. I’ve grouped them into three sections: Top Products, Blockchain, and AI.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #8: R1 1776 Goes Open-Source, Cardex Gets Hacked, and Grok-3 Debuts
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Technology is moving fast, and AI and blockchain are at the center of it all. In this blog, we’ll look at some recent news and tools that show how these fields are growing and what that means for the future.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #7: 10x AI Cost Reduction, Lyft’s 2026 Robotaxi Milestone, and Solana ETF Buzz
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Welcome to our roundup of the most exciting developments in AI and blockchain. From cutting-edge low-code platforms to the latest Ethereum upgrades, here’s what you need to know.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #6: Trending Products, DeepSeek Wave, and Ethereum Predictions
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This recap after Lunar New Year highlights some of the most promising products and companies making an impact, along with key trends in AI and cryptocurrency.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #5: VC Trends, Blockchain Breakthroughs, and AI Innovations
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Follow the Money 1. The US: Golden Ticket Why It Matters: The US alone raised $190.7B in VC funding in 2024, more than the rest of the world combined.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #4: AI Supercomputers, Mini AI PCs, Worldcoin Expansion, and SEA VC
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: AI sector Nvidia’s Personal AI Supercomputer: Nvidia has unveiled Digits, a $3,000 desktop AI supercomputer designed for researchers and enthusiasts.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #3: AI’s Ubiquity at CES, Wall Street’s AI Boom, and Blockchain Innovations
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: AI sector CES 2025 in Las Vegas was all about artificial intelligence, with Nvidia’s CEO Jensen Huang delivering the keynote and showcasing their latest AI chips for personal computers.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #2: AI Talent Wars, OpenAI’s New Models, Hyperliquid’s Rise
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hey there, another week brings a fresh mix of tech stories worth talking about. Let’s break it down, keep things chill, and see what’s been happening.

item.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #1: Gemini 2.0, OpenAI’s Sora, a16z’s Predictions
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: It’s been a busy week in the world of tech, with some huge announcements shaping the future of AI, quantum computing, and beyond.

item.title: What's New in February 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting Tech Signals - Latest findings on Serverless Computing, AI & ML, FinOps and CyberSecurity Research Topics 2024 - 40 topics on the most promising technologies.

item.title: Partners Network
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We seek for Partners, individuals and companies likewise, to develop a co-creation system driven by mutual purposes and interests. With our average deal size at $30,000, a partner can generate at least $2,400 per project.

item.title: Consulting Team
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Who we are We’re a team of tech experts who solve business problems. We combine technical skills with good communication to help companies overcome challenges.

item.title: Digest
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This page holds a collection of both our internal and external events, including the things we do with the Labs team, Consulting team, Operations, team, and the community.

item.title: Estimation Guidelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When we conduct an estimation, it is recommended to abandon the transitional “exact hours” assessment method, instead, use the story point based on the Fibonacci number (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21…).

item.title: Project Delivery Schedule and Guidelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Weekly Activities Weekly Points/Effort Report Every Friday Action: Fill out the weekly points/effort report. Link: Weekly Report Spreadsheet. Deadline for Data Sync: Data is sync by EOD next Tuesday.

item.title: FBSC
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Budget We do need to know clients’ budgets. This is often uncomfortable for them but their budget helps determines what scope is possible.

item.title: How to work with clients
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: TRAINING COURSE: HOW TO WORK WITH CLIENT What skills that an engineer should have in order to work with client effectively?

item.title: Service Feedbacks
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: GENERAL QUESTIONS FOR SERVICE FEEDBACKS Engineer performances a. Communication How did the engineer interact with your team? How was the communication between the engineer and your team?

item.title: Setting The Budget
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: One of the most important questions at the start of a project is how much it will cost. It is vital to make sure that enough budget is available to allow for the development of a viable product.

item.title: Fixed Budget Scope Controlled
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) is applied at Atomic Object. They build custom software for our customers. Because of the complexity involved in building a great software product, software development projects are always more difficult to price than a product.
